text: Luise Rainer (January 12, 1910 - December 30, 2014) was a two-time Academy Award-winning German-born Austrian-American movie actress. She was the first person to win two Academy Awards in a row. The first was for her role as Anna Held in The Great Ziegfeld, and the second was for her role as a Chinese farmer in The Good Earth. Rainer was born in Duesseldorf and was Jewish. Rainer died from pneumonia in her home in London, England, aged 104. ==References== ==Other websites== * *Photographs of Luise Rainer Category:1910 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Actors from North Rhine-Westphalia Category:American centenarians Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Austrian Jews Category:Austrian movie actors Category:Austrian stage actors Category:Austrian television actors Category:Best Actress Academy Award winners Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:German centenarians Category:German Jews Category:German movie actors Category:German television actors Category:Infectious disease deaths in England Category:Jewish American actors
title: Luise Rainer
